subproject.description:
The objective of the CSR Mapping Project is to provide a baseline and a resource that will inform and direct the development of corporate social responsibility in Trinidad and Tobago in order to help the private sector play a more meaningful role in Trinidad and Tobago social development.
Output
•	A comprehensive data model and database of CSR initiatives in T&T
•	A baseline study to drive standardization of reporting and sustainability
•	A final report that presents initial information on the practice of CSR in T&T and how it relates to global trends, presents analysis and findings, and presents recommendations on how to use the findings of the research
•	An electronic resource (web portal) that will act as a local hub for CSR in T&T bringing donor institutions and recipients together in a single market-place; a sustainable resource that will be the cornerstone underpinning the development of CSR in T&T. The web portal will be a freely available resource that will continually update the CSR Map, provide up-to-date CSR Learning Tools, facilitate partnerships through forums and CSR News, and can host additional research contributing to the development of CSR in T&T. 
•	An awareness and stake-holder event to launch the report and portal simultaneously to build awareness of and contribute to the growing momentum behind CSR in T&T

Expected Outcomes:
•	Heightened awareness of CSR best practices through research interview process.
•	Increased coordination and coherence in the development of CSR programmes amongst the Private Sector
•	Improve information and data to support policy development and decision making at the Public and Private levels
•	Improved relations between UNDP / STCIC and the private sector leading to increased partnership collaboration
•	Identification of success factors and short comings of CSR including confirmation or denial of the following expectations:
o	Advanced CSR practiced by the energy sector while local private sector implements traditional, philanthropic approach
o	Overall focus on external CSR activity
o	Issue, community, execution saturation
o	Lack of sustainability of initiatives
o	Lack of alignment with Vision 2020 and MDGs
•	Provision of tools and evidence to steer development of CSR Towards alignment with Vision 2020 and MDGs
•	Build momentum towards CSR in T&T
•	Build momentum towards other UNDP PSE products like the Global Compact and CSR Luncheons
